summary: The International Court of Justice (ICJ), also known as the World Court, is the main court for resolving disputes between countries. It's part of the United Nations and is in The Hague, Netherlands. The ICJ replaced an earlier court after World War II. It has 15 judges from different countries, elected by the UN. These judges serve for nine years, making sure various legal systems are represented. The court has handled many cases since 1947, and its decisions are final and binding for the countries involved.
title: International Court of Justice
